result.name: child-maintenance-debt-management
result.notes:
These  are systems in which support the collection of child maintenance arrears, debt enforcement activity and/or offences against Child Maintenance legislation.  
Investigations  - where an offence has been suspected of having occurred which is against Child Maintenance Law.  This can be relating to a legal action taken against a Person or External Organisation, the goal of which is not directly the recovery of debt but punishment for non-compliance or illegal behaviour (e.g. fraud, violence). Enforcement Actions  - where a debt exists in a child maintenance case and action is required to recover that debt by gaining possession or realising the value of a debtor's asset(s). For example databases contain information about: data includes: personal and financial details, assets,  organisation/employer details, debt period, type of action taken, information relating to an instance of a communication activity between the Child Maintenance Group and a person or external organisation e.g. letters, telephone calls, meetings, details of any evidence. These systems are used in GB and Northern Ireland.

organization.name: department-for-work-and-pensions
organization.title: Department for Work and Pensions
organization.description:
The Department for Work and Pensions (DWP) is responsible for welfare and pension policy and is a key player in tackling child poverty. It is the biggest public service delivery department in the UK and serves over 20 million customers.

DWP is a ministerial department, supported by 13 agencies and public bodies.

https://www.gov.uk/government/organisations/department-for-work-pensions
